results.title: Andre
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Annette Handley, Adam Shapiro and Kushner-Locke Production
results.brief_description: Andre, an adorable seal is orphaned when his mother is caught in a fishing net. The harbour master, his wife and three children adopt the lovable pup and nurse him back to health. Andre forms a special relationship with seven year-old tomboy Toni and the two prove that true friendship can survive the toughest trials.

results.title: Free Willy 2: the adventure home
results.creator_credit: Dwight Little, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Lauren Shuler, Donner Productions and Shuler-Donner
results.brief_description: Jesse is reunited with his Orca friend Willy who has rejoined his family in the wild. Willy becomes trapped by an oil spill fire and Jesse is determined to rescue Willy even if it means risking his own life. Action packed adventure with superb photography, this is a film to be shared by all the family and lovers of whales.

results.title: The Birthday party
results.creator_credit: William Friedkin, Milton Subotsky, Max J Rosenberg and Palomar Pictures
results.brief_description: Screenplay written by Harold Pinter. In a shabby seaside English boarding house, a man’s inability to cope with his fears and guilt comes to the surface. At first, in typical Pinter style, the conversation is trivial and banal but deepens and erupts from the commonplace and comic into terror. Stars Robert Shaw, Patrick Magee and Dandy Nichols.

results.title: The Indian in the cupboard
results.creator_credit: Frank Oz, Jane Startz, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Scholastic Productions and Kennedy/Marshall Company
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Lynne Reid Banks, ‘The Indian in the cupboard’ is a heartwarming adventure about nine year old Omri who magically brings his three-inch toy Indian Little Bear to life. Some of the scenes may not be suitable for very young children however the amazing adventures of these two friends is sure to delight.

results.title: The Secret adventures of Tom Thumb
results.creator_credit: Bolexbrothers, Hengemeth Panahi, Thierry Garrel, Colin Rose and Richard Hutchinson
results.brief_description: This post-industrial version of the famous fariytale is given a Kafkaesque feel. Employing pixillation techniques which combine human, model and plasticine forms, the directors create a unique visual style. Leading a bleak existence in a nightmare city, a poor childless couple is suddenly and bloodily blessed with a tiny boy. their joy is short-lived for the Ministry of Sinistry agents kidnap Tom and whisk him off to the laboratory of a thousand terrors, a centre of terrifying and sadistic experiments. In this netherworld of pain, Tom finds himself among bizarre creatures, part fur, feather, bane and flesh. To escape is fraught with danger, but to stay is fatal. Technically flawless in the evocation of its grim and apocalyptic world, this film fuses its many influences, from the Quay Brothers and Svankmajer, to the short films of Starewicz, into a superbly integrated and coherent vision of evil and innocence. WARNING: Not suitable for children as some scenes may disturb some viewers.

results.title: The Bicycle thieves = Ladri di biciclette
results.brief_description: An unemployed man is offered work as a bill-sticker provided he has his own bicycle. After retrieving his bicycle from the pawnbroker, it is stolen on the very first day of the job and he spends a day with his small son, desperately trying to find it. Hollywood offered to finance De Sica’s film, but he refused as he wanted to use non-actors in real settings. ‘The Bicycle thieves’ is an important film which explores the dignity of the ordinary person. It’s simplicity and underlying social criticism are part of its wide appeal.

results.title: Cries from the deep
results.creator_credit: Jacques Gagne, Jean-Michel Cousteau, Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Jacques Bobet, Cousteau Society and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The first of a two-part series, this film records the journey undertaken by marine explorer Jacques-Yves Cousteau, his 24-member team, and a Natianal Film Board of Canada crew. Working from the ‘Calypso’, a converted minesweeper transformed into a sophisticated oceanographic vessel, the team uses a helicopter, a diving saucer, inflatable boats and scuba diving equipment to explore the Grand Banks of Newfoundland, one of the world’s richest fishing areas. They discover shipwrecks, film icebergs, visit wildlife sanctuaries, where man is still an alien presence, and observe such endangered species as the beluga whale, humpback whale and harp seal. There is a fasscinating sequence showing ‘Calypso’ divers freeing a calf whale entrapped in a fishing net.

results.title: Trainspotting
results.creator_credit: Danny Boyle, Andrew McDonald, Channel 4, Noel Gay Motion Picture Company and Figment Films
results.brief_description: Based on the cult novel by Irvine Welsh, “Trainspotting” is a black comedy which looks at a group of junkies in Edinburgh. Mark Renton, “the hero” of the film takes the viewer on a journey of discovery. Heroin is his mistress and the need to find and use it dictates the course of everyday events in his life. Renton’s friends share the same passions and needs as they lie, steal, cheat, and go “off their faces” in order to procure the next fix. As they edge towards self-destruction, the film never loses sight of their vulnerability or their very human weaknesses. At times graphically squalid and bleak, the film is undeniably hilarious, although not for the weak-stomached. A great soundtrack is featured together with excellent performances by Ewan McGregor, Ewen Bremner, Jonny Lee Miller, Kevin McKidd, Kelly Macdonald and Robert Carlyle.

results.title: 101 dalmatians
results.creator_credit: Stephen Herek, Ricardo Mestres, John Hughes, Walt Disney Pictures and Great Oaks
results.brief_description: This live-action adapted version of Dodie Smith’s classic children’s story will delight and amaze the whole family. Cruella De Vil (Glenn Close) is a woman with a passionate obsession for fur coats. Her quest is to have a coat made from the skin of the sweet dalmation pups owned by Anita and her husband Roger. The pups are kidnapped by two bumbling henchmen and Pongo and Perdita, the pups’ parents, enlist a canine army to execute a daring rescue. The special effects are outstanding as are the performances by an excellent cast, particularly Glenn Close. Co-starring Joely Richardson, Jeff Daniels, Joan Plowright and Hugh Laurie.

results.title: The Blob
results.creator_credit: Irvin S. Yeaworth, Jack H. Harris and Valley Forge Films Studios
results.brief_description: The uncut colour version of the cult Sci-Fi film that established McQueen’s star quality. A small town becomes engulfed in terror when a meteorite crashes in a lonely field. McQueen and his girlfriend must convince the townsfolk to action but face total disbelief and ridicule towards what seems a fabrication by confused kids. A slimy alien gel begins swallowing people and growing larger. Classic scenes include a packed cinema screening a horror movie when the slimy gel seeps from the projector window causing an unforgetable exit of panic. Starring Steve McQueen, Aneta Corseaut and Earl Rowe. Co-starring Olin Howlin, Steven Chase and John Benson. Includes rare career highlights of Steve McQueen including famous film and television roles such as “Wanted: Dead or Alive”, “The Great Escape” and “The Defender” (with an early William “Star Trek” Shatner) and a very brief interview in relation to his off-screen dare-devil motor bike racing.
